medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began five days before admission with itching on the head and back and skin lesions on the abdomen. The rash gradually spread to the back, arms, and legs despite treatment. After increasing prednisone from 5 to 40 mg, symptoms worsened, leading to painful rash and a sore throat with dysphagia, along with a fever. The headache was rated 8 out of 10.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Polymyalgia rheumatica, giant-cell arteritis, rheumatoid arthritis; treated with prednisone and hydroxychloroquine.
medical_history.social_history: Lives alone, active lifestyle, does not smoke, drinks alcohol rarely.
